V.ii.1.A.5.c
.
Handling Imbalanced Evidence
If the evidence shows an overwhelming imbalance, then the evidence requires a decision in that direction, either for or against awarding the claim.
Note
:  The claim must be awarded if all of the evidence is favorable.
Reference
:  For more information on awarding benefits when all of the evidence is favorable, see
Traut v. Brown
, 6 Vet.App. 495 (1994), and
Rose v. West
, 11 Vet.App. 169 (1998).
